{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3528603,"name":"csos","username":"csos","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/58956e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T12:02:17.956Z","cooked":"

Hello,

In our ChiefDelphi project we are trying to move to a specific target position using PathPlanner’s pathfindToPose method. However, the methods assigned to the b and x buttons sometimes get confused. Especially when the b button is pressed, sometimes driveToReefLeft() and sometimes driveToReefRight() methods are expected to work. Similarly, when the x button is pressed, sometimes driveToReefRight() works.

We use a code structure like below:

m_driverController.b().toggleOnTrue(new DeferredCommand(
    () -> drivebase.driveToReefRight(), Set.of(drivebase)));
m_driverController.x().toggleOnTrue(new DeferredCommand(
    () -> drivebase.driveToReefLeft(), Set.of(drivebase)));

And we redirect to the target position using PathPlanner’s pathfindToPose method:

  public Command driveToReefRight() {
    PathConstraints constraints = new PathConstraints(
        1, 1,
        Units.degreesToRadians(180), Units.degreesToRadians(180));
    Pose2d targetPose = getReefPoseRight();
    return AutoBuilder.pathfindToPose(targetPose, constraints);
  }

  public Command driveToReefLeft() {
    PathConstraints constraints = new PathConstraints(
        1, 1,
        Units.degreesToRadians(180), Units.degreesToRadians(180));
    Pose2d targetPose = getReefPoseLeft();
    return AutoBuilder.pathfindToPose(targetPose, constraints);
  }

Here, the getReefPoseRight() or getReefPoseLeft() functions determine the target positions. However, when the b button is pressed, sometimes the driveToReefLeft() and sometimes the driveToReefRight() methods work. This behavior occurs because the methods are not linked together correctly.

We think this is a confusion about how PathPlanner and pathfindToPose are integrated. The methods are not triggering correctly and are interfering with each other.

We are looking for your help on how we can develop a solution for this issue.

Thank you!

Toggleontrue will require 2 button presses to go from false to true to false again. It is a toggle. Ontrue is probably what you want

Toggle is dangerous and confusing as @icemannie suggests. Maybe this will help you understand what you did wrong that when one command interrupts the other command the command state changes and toggle flips the state from whatever it was so pressing a can seem to affect b and b affects a.

“Toggles a command state when the condition changes from false to true. If the command is currently running when toggled, it is canceled. If it is not currently running when toggled, it is started. (If a command state is changed by other forces, the trigger logic doesn’t care about that timeline. The trigger is only looking at the current state of the command without regard to how that state came about be it by this toggle, another trigger, or the command managing itself in some way.)”

hello first of all thank you for your help. i need to specify a few more details. when i toggleOnTrue, everything works as it should work in the simulation. when we tried with onTrue, it was working properly in the simulation again, but we encountered the same problem in the real robot. The problem is exactly that when the B key is pressed, driveToReefLeft() works successfully, then when I click the X key, it acts like B again and driveToReefLeft() works, but when I press the X key again, driveToReefRight() works successfully. I need to press it more than once.

tried both onTrue and toogleOnTrue

note : the position values returned from the methods are absolutely correct. and there is no error in the simulation, the error starts to happen in real life

If it still doesn’t work right and you are stumped then it’s time for logging some actions. The easiest to do is add a print at the start of your command you run from the button presses to assure that you are in the right place at the right time. If that isn’t insightful then log the command scheduler command events.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

The Command Scheduler

The CommandScheduler( Java, C++) is the class responsible for actually running commands. Each iteration (ordinarily once per 20ms), the scheduler polls all registered buttons, schedules commands fo...

And make sure your Set.of(drivebase) is as you expect.

Is the problem only going from one to the other? If you drive away each time to another position, does everything work as expected?
Wondering if you are falling inside Pathplanner’s minimum distance.

Weirdly enough we are having this EXACT same issue. We made 2 buttons to call two different commands, one to align with the right side of the reef and the other to the left here in our robot container.

new POVButton(m_driver, 90).whileTrue(new dpadAlign2(m_robotDrive));
new POVButton(m_driver, 270).whileTrue(new dpadAlign(m_robotDrive));

The issue is, is that these two commands, even though they tell the robot to align to two different spots, will call the wrong pathfindToPose command and be off by one iteration. What I mean by this is if we press right on the d-pad (to align to the right of the april tag) then it will work the first time. But if we then press left on the d-pad, it will align to the right of the april tag. If we press left again, only then will it align to the left of the april tag. This pattern continues.

I’ll also link one of the d-pad align commands here but also here’s the code that uses Pathplanner:

// Called when the command is initially scheduled.
@Override
public void initialize() {
if (LimelightHelpers.getTV(“limelight-gcc”)) {
Command pathFindCommand = AutoBuilder.pathfindToPose(//getPoseOffset(
getBestAprilTag(), constraints);
pathFindCommand.schedule();
}
}

We’ve done a lot of troubleshooting and have narrowed it down to something to do with how Pathplanner schedules commands- but are unsure how to approach any fix

Hello, we think the problem is that the pathplanner’s pathfindToPose command is heavy and has difficulty calculating. We were getting a lot of Command Scheduler Loop Overrun errors. After solving this for other reasons, this error started to occur only once or twice every 5 minutes.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T05:41:28.845Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":22,"readers_count":21,"score":4.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491914,"topic_slug":"confusion-between-pathplanner-pathfindtopose-and-buttons","display_username":"csos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69118,"username":"Jason81","name":"Jason","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69234,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/confusion-between-pathplanner-pathfindtopose-and-buttons/491914/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3532642,"name":"icemannie","username":"icemannie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T12:02:23.391Z","cooked":"

Couple of things.
Inside the dpadAlign command you linked, you have a method called getBestAprilTag() that runs once on initialize() and once on isFinished() - with the same result.
It calls another method getClosestAprilTagID() that loops through calculations for each tag - 24 times total.
Commands have 20ms to run or - loop overruns
public boolean isFinished() {
return m_drive.getPose().equals(getBestAprilTag());
}
is looking for the robot pose to be exactly equal to the targeted tag pose - not going to happen often.
The Command requires drive so subsequent button pushes will cancel the current command.
If you want to continue this way, there are only 6 reef tags per alliance. Just loop those. Keep track of the bestAprilTag on the first calculation and use it in the inFinished()
Set a tolerance on how close the 2 poses have to be to finish.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T12:04:49.567Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":21,"readers_count":20,"score":9.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491914,"topic_slug":"confusion-between-pathplanner-pathfindtopose-and-buttons","display_username":"icemannie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69118,"username":"Jason81","name":"Jason","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28240,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/confusion-between-pathplanner-pathfindtopose-and-buttons/491914/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3532699,"name":"MrNick","username":"MrNick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrnick/{size}/8269_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T13:48:36.883Z","cooked":"

I think the issue is that your new DeferredCommands are re-using the same Command object with each execution. The documentation for DeferredCommands states: “Note that the supplier must create a new Command each call”. So, I think you need to create command factories for driveToReefRight and driveToReefLeft and use those in the DeferredCommand lambda so that you are generating a new command with each call. I’ve seen strange behavior when trying to re-use commands in other ways. Command factories are your friends.

oh wait…nevermind. Autobuilder is doing that…hmmm…
